Description: Mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a Monogrammed Cross. Near the wick-hole are small volutes. The lamp stands on a raised base. The handle is missing. Covered with a red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q2066)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Museum of Practical Geology
